instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging issue
threads.message:
I have another macbook with charging issues it was after liquid damage in keyboard back light area. I fixed display issue.
I already replaced battery and port they are fine. 
Once i connecting  charger to the laptop orange light came up but in system laptop shows information battery is not charging.
I measure voltage around port connector and compare to second laptop with is charging fine on diode <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> pin PPVIN i have only 0,6V , working one have 12V.
Any idea where I should start with it? 
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging issue
threads.message: Tried known good battery? Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? Sounds like possibly a current sensing issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging issue
threads.message:
"Tried known good battery? Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/isl6259ahrtz.html"]<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>[/URL]? Sounds like possibly a current sensing issue. "
Why are you asking about a battery that was already tried and the problem has already been pointed out at <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>!

Without voltage at <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>, does this thing power on from charger only?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging issue
threads.message: Battery part I didnâ€™t see sense resistor part wrong post and forum entirely got jumbled af work my bad Duke.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging issue
threads.message:
Laptop not turning on on charger, I replaced  <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> but still same issue, resistance between
pin 17/18 - 4 ohm
pin 27/28 - 20 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charging issue
threads.message: You replaced the ISL while there is no voltage at <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>....Issue is more likely around <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>, check voltage there.
